note.p: Death: His home, Chaucer Road, Cambridge (04 April 1923)
Education: Highgate School; Islington School; Caius College, Cambridge. BA (1857), MA (1860), ScD (1884)

Career: Fellow, Caius College, Cambridge (1857-1923); President (1912-1913); ordained deacon (1858); ordained priest (1859); Curate, Cheshunt, Hertfordshire (1858-1859); Curate, Mortlake, Surrey (1860-1862); Lecturer in Logic and Moral Philosophy, Cambridge (1862); Huslean Lecturer (1869); invented a bowling machine for cricket; gave his collection of books on logic to Cambridge University Library
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; DSB; Venn
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1926 vol 110 pp x-xi, plate, signed by W B H
